title: Instructional Design for Enhancing Diversity and Inclusion in Continuing Medical Education (CME)

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Curriculum design integrating diversity and inclusion elements into math-based medical data analysis training for current practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can identify at least three social identity bias factors (e.g., race, gender) in CME content development and propose improvement strategies.
Learners can design inclusive instructional materials (including visual/audio resources) for diverse learners in blended learning environments.
Learners can develop two evaluation survey questions for CME that incorporate bias and inclusivity metrics.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
